column4: hi. does anyone know how to make a virtual windows xp machine running in virtualbox be able to accept incoming internet connections... i was thinking if i could assign a network card solely for the virtual machine the problem would be solved but i do not know how to . can anyone help? thanks in advance
I don't quite understand your question. I just know that I can browse the Internet within the virtual machine without problems. Do you mean some sort of server?
i guess you could say that. i want the virtual machine to be accesible online from the outside like for example to have an ftp server, to use bittorrent correctly, etc etc
ah. I've never used it that way. But it is very possible as you just figured out.
but i dont know how to do it.. with vmware i could select which network card to use for my virtual machine but with virtualbox i dont know
I mean, I think virtualization is supposed to help you do that, so it's definitely possible. But don't know with Virtualbox. By the way have you read the manual, I think it covers a lot of things.
